meanings.definition: The act of casting votes in an election or survey.
meanings.sent1: During the polling, citizens lined up to cast their votes for the new mayor.
meanings.sent2: The polling station was busy with people participating in the election.
meanings.sent3: The polling process felt like a fun community event.
meanings.sent4: In the world of polling, every vote counts like a drop in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of polling day filled the air with anticipation.

meanings.definition: The process of collecting data or opinions from a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The company conducted polling to gather feedback from customers about their products.
meanings.sent2: Online polling has become a popular way to gather opinions from a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The polling results showed that most people prefer chocolate over vanilla.
meanings.sent4: In the world of marketing, polling is like a compass guiding decisions.
meanings.sent5: The accuracy of polling depends on the diversity of the participants.

meanings.definition: The counting or recording of votes or opinions.
meanings.sent1: After the polling closed, the officials began counting the votes.
meanings.sent2: Accurate polling is crucial for determining the outcome of an election.
meanings.sent3: The polling results were so close that a recount was necessary.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, polling can sway the direction of a campaign.
meanings.sent5: The transparency of polling ensures the integrity of the process.
